name: Scarface
synopsis: In Miami in 1980, Cuban refugee Tony Montana (Al Pacino) buys his way into the local drug trafficking scene, quickly making a name for himself as a ruthless killer. He works for drug lord Frank Lopez (Robert Loggia) and grows increasingly power-hungry, even killing Lopez on behalf of rival kingpin Alejandro Sosa (Paul Shenar). As Montana's wealth and influence grow, so does his ego, and he becomes monstrously paranoid, alienating himself from his friends and family. When Sosa orders a hit on Montana, he narrowly escapes death, but his wife and sister are killed. Enraged, Montana declares war on Sosa, leading to a bloody all-out battle that ends with Montana's death.

name: Taxi Driver
synopsis: In Taxi Driver, a mentally unstable Vietnam War veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action, attempting to save a preadolescent prostitute in the process.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
synopsis: The film To Kill a Mockingbird is set in the 1930s in the fictional Maycomb County, Alabama, and follows six-year-old Scout Finch, who lives with her older brother, Jem, and their father, Atticus Finch. Atticus is a moral man and a single father who is appointed to defend a black man, Tom Robinson, who has been accused of a crime he did not commit. The trial reveals the racism that is entrenched in the town, and Scout and Jem learn first-hand the ugly truths about prejudice and injustice. Despite the odds, Atticus strives to do what is right, and in the end, justice is served.

name: The Sting
synopsis: The Sting is a 1973 American caper film set in September 1936, involving a complex plot by two professional grifters (Paul Newman and Robert Redford) to con a mob boss (Robert Shaw). The film was directed by George Roy Hill, who previously directed Newman and Redford in Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid.

name: Ikiru
synopsis: Widower and Tokyo city bureaucrat Watanabe (Takashi Shimura) is diagnosed with cancer and told he has only six months to live. At first, he tries to keep his diagnosis a secret from his son and colleagues, but he eventually comes to terms with his mortality. Watanabe then becomes determined to find meaning in his remaining time and sets out to do something significant with his life. He first tries to help a young boy in his neighborhood, but his efforts are thwarted by bureaucracy. Watanabe then comes up with the idea to create a park in memory of his late wife, which will be a place for children to play. With the help of his son and a young woman he meets along the way, Watanabe is able to see his plan through to completion before he dies.

name: Hamilton
synopsis: Hamilton is the story of American Founding Father Alexander Hamilton, told through the unique lens of hip-hop. The film follows Hamilton from his humble beginnings in the West Indies to his rise to prominence during the American Revolution and his eventual downfall. Along the way, we see Hamilton's relationships with his wife Eliza, his friend and fellow revolutionary Aaron Burr, and his political rival Thomas Jefferson. The film culminates in the famous duel between Hamilton and Burr that ended Hamilton's life.

name: L.A. Confidential
synopsis: L.A. Confidential is a 1997 American neo-noir crime film directed, produced, and co-written by Curtis Hanson. Based on James Ellroy's 1990 novel of the same name, the screenplay was written by Hanson and Brian Helgeland. The film tells the story of three policemen in 1950s Los Angeles, each of whom is corrupt in his own way, as they investigate a series of murders they believe has connections to a pornographer, who may also be linked to the death of one of the policemen's partners. L.A. Confidential features Kevin Spacey, Russell Crowe, Guy Pearce, James Cromwell, Kim Basinger, and Danny DeVito.The film was nominated for nine Academy Awards, including Best Picture, winning two: Basinger for Best Supporting Actress and Hanson and Helgeland for Best Adapted Screenplay. It was also nominated for and won several other awards, including the Golden Globe Award for Best Motion Picture â Drama, the Writers Guild of America Award for Best Adapted Screenplay, and the British Academy of Film and Television Arts Award for Best Screenplay.

name: Up
synopsis: in the AirUp in the Air is a 2009 American drama film directed by Jason Reitman and written by Reitman and Sheldon Turner, based on the 2001 novel of the same name, written by Walter Kirn. The story is centered on corporate "downsizer" Ryan Bingham (George Clooney) and his travels around the United States.

name: Heat
synopsis: In the movie "Heat", a group of professional criminals are planning a major heist. They have planned and rehearsed for months, but things start to go wrong when one of the members of the group is killed. The police are called in and the criminals are forced to take hostages. The situation quickly spirals out of control and the criminals are forced to fight for their lives.

name: Metropolis
synopsis: In a future city, workers toil day and night to keep the machines running while the elite enjoy a life of luxury. One day, a young woman named Maria arrives in the city and is taken in by the worker's leader, Freder. He falls in love with her, but she only has eyes for the city's ruler, Joh Fredersen. As Freder begins to question the city's hierarchy, he is caught up in a revolt that could destroy the city.

name: Snatch
synopsis: The movie is set in the London criminal underworld and follows a group of small time crooks who are trying to make a name for themselves. They get caught up in a heist that goes wrong, and all hell breaks loose. As they try to escape the city with their lives and their loot, they are pursued by a vicious gangster and his henchmen.

name: A Separation
synopsis: A married couple, Simin and Nader, live in Iran. Simin wants to leave the country with her husband and daughter to have a better life, but Nader does not want to leave his father, who has Alzheimer's disease. They get a divorce, and Simin moves out of the house. Nader hires a woman named Razieh to take care of his father while he is at work. Razieh is pregnant, and she is not able to take care of the old man by herself. Nader gets angry with Razieh and pushes her, causing her to fall and miscarry. Razieh's husband finds out and wants to take Nader to court. Nader's wife decides to testify against him, and Nader is sent to prison.

name: Die Hard
synopsis: New York City police officer John McClane (Bruce Willis) is visiting his estranged wife (Bonnie Bedelia) and two daughters on Christmas Eve. He joins her at a party in the headquarters of the Japanese-owned business she works for. The festivities are interrupted by a group of terrorists who take the guests hostage. McClane escapes detection and sets out to stop the terrorists. He kills several of them and wounds their leader, Hans Gruber (Alan Rickman). McClane then faces off against Hans' henchman, Karl (Alexander Godunov), in a final showdown.

name: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
synopsis: In the third installment of the Indiana Jones franchise, Indiana Jones is on a race to find his father, Henry Jones Sr., who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Indy must find the Grail before the Nazis do, and he enlists the help of his father's former colleague, Marcus Brody. With the Nazis hot on their trail, the Joneses embark on a dangerous quest that takes them across the globe. Along the way, they must face snakes, Nazis, and the deadly traps set by the Grail's guardian. In the end, Indy finds the Grail and returns it to its rightful place, but not before having to say goodbye to his father.

name: Incendies
synopsis: Incendies is a 2010 Canadian mystery drama film directed by Denis Villeneuve and written by Villeneuve and Wajdi Mouawad. It is based on Mouawad's play of the same name. The film stars MÃ©lanie Laurent, Maxim Gaudette, and MichÃ¨le Lonsdale.Incendies follows twins Simon and Jeanne as they attempt to uncover the truth about their mother's life and death. Their search leads them to the Middle East, where they uncover a dark secret from their mother's past.The film was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film at the 83rd Academy Awards.

name: Bicycle Thieves
synopsis: In post-World War II Italy, a man's bicycle is stolen, and he and his son set out on a journey to find it. Along the way, the father and son form a bond as they search for the bicycle in the city.

At the height of the First World War, two young British soldiers, Schofield and Blake are given a seemingly impossible mission. In a race against time, they must cross enemy territory and deliver a message that will stop a deadly attack on hundreds of soldiersâBlake's own brother among them.

name: Like Stars on Earth
synopsis: Ishaan Awasthi is an eight-year-old boy who's always getting into trouble at school. When he's sent to a boarding school in Mumbai, he meets his new art teacher, Ram Shankar Nikumbh. Ishaan is a terrible student, but Mr. Nikumbh sees something special in him. With patience and creativity, he helps Ishaan find his true potential.

name: Downfall
synopsis: In April of 1945, Germany stands at the brink of defeat with the Soviet Army closing in from the west and the Allied Army attacking from the south. In Berlin, capital of the Third Reich, Adolf Hitler (Bruno Ganz) refuses to accept defeat, insisting that Germany will fight to the last man. As the days go by and the noose around the city tightens, the people of Berlin become increasingly desperate. With the city under siege and supplies running low, Hitler retreats into his underground bunker, where he and his followers make their final stand against the Allies.

name: For a Few Dollars More
synopsis: The movie is a spaghetti Western that follows the story of two bounty hunters who team up to capture a ruthless outlaw. The outlaw is wanted for murder, and the bounty hunters are determined to bring him to justice. They track him down to a small town, where they face off in a final showdown. In the end, the bounty hunters prevail, and the outlaw is brought to justice.

name: Batman Begins
synopsis: In the film, Bruce Wayne (Christian Bale) returns to Gotham City after years of self-imposed exile, determined to purge the city of the evil that took the life of his parents. As he comes to grips with his past and sets out on his path to becoming the Caped Crusader, he encounters a number of people who will impact his life, including the enigmatic Lucius Fox (Morgan Freeman), the loyal butler Alfred Pennyworth (Michael Caine), the fearless police lieutenant Jim Gordon (Gary Oldman), and the beautiful doctor Rachel Dawes (Katie Holmes). But it is his encounters with the League of Shadows and its leader, Ra's Al Ghul (Liam Neeson), that set him on the path to discovering the ultimate weapon against evil.

name: Dangal
synopsis: Dangal is a 2016 Indian Hindi-language biographical sports drama film directed by Nitesh Tiwari, written by Piyush Gupta, Shreyas Jain, and Nikhil Mehrotra, and produced by Aamir Khan and Kiran Rao. The film stars Aamir Khan as Mahavir Singh Phogat, who taught wrestling to his daughters Geeta Phogat and Babita Kumari. The film chronicles the struggle of Phogat, who was forced to give up his dream of winning a gold medal for India in wrestling, due to the lack of support from the wrestling establishment. He instead trains his daughters to be world-class wrestlers. The film was released on 23 December 2016.

name: The Kid
synopsis: The Kid is a heartwarming story about a young boy named Billy who is taken in by a kindly couple after his mother abandons him. They raise him as their own and he grows up to be a happy, well-adjusted young man. When his mother suddenly reappears and wants to take him back, Billy must decide whether to stay with the family he loves or go with the woman who gave him life.

name: Some Like It Hot
synopsis: When two male musicians witness the St. Valentine's Day Massacre, they quickly dress in drag and join an all-female band headed for a gig in Florida. Joe (Tony Curtis) and Jerry (Jack Lemmon) become Josephine and Daphne, much to the chagrin of bandleader Sweet Sue (Sugar Kane's (Marilyn Monroe) ukulele-playing beau, Osgood Fielding III (Joe E. Brown). While Jerry/Daphne pines for Sugar, Joe/Josephine falls for the band's saxophonist, Bix Biederbeck (George Raft). Meanwhile, the real Daphne has fallen for Jerry, and a gangster is looking for the two musicians who witnessed the massacre.

name: The Father
synopsis: The Father is a 2020 drama film directed by Florian Zeller and starring Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman. The film follows Anthony, an aging man with dementia, as he deals with the loss of his wife and the reality of his deteriorating mental state. His daughter, Anne, tries to help him as best she can, but as his condition deteriorates, she finds herself struggling to care for him. The film is a moving portrait of the effects of dementia on both the sufferer and their loved ones.

name: All About Eve
synopsis: Margo Channing is the star of a Broadway play. Eve Harrington is an ambitious young woman who ingratiates herself with Margo and becomes her assistant. As Eve manipulates those around her to further her own career, Margo begins to see through her ambitious protÃ©gÃ©.

name: Green Book
synopsis: In the 1960s, African American pianist Don Shirley (Mahershala Ali) hires Italian American bouncer Tony Lip (Viggo Mortensen) to drive him on a concert tour through the Deep South in the days when racial segregation and violence were commonplace. Despite their differences, the two men develop a close friendship as they confront racism and danger while navigating their way through a complicated world. Based on a true story, Green Book is a heartwarming tale of friendship and overcoming adversity.

name: The Wolf of Wall Street
synopsis: In the early 1990s, Jordan Belfort (Leonardo DiCaprio) is a stockbroker living the high life working for a firm on Wall Street. His world comes crashing down when he is indicted for fraud and sentenced to four years in prison. When he is released, he is eager to get back to his old ways and make as much money as possible. However, the financial world has changed and he must find new ways to make money. He turns to a life of crime and starts a new firm with his friend Donnie (Jonah Hill). They quickly make a fortune through illegal activities, such as insider trading and money laundering. However, the FBI is closing in on them and they must find a way to keep the government from taking everything away from them.

name: Judgment at Nuremberg
synopsis: A group of Nazi judges are on trial for war crimes in Nuremberg in 1948. The film follows the trial and the events leading up to it.

name: Unforgiven
synopsis: The Unforgiven is a 1992 American revisionist Western film directed by Clint Eastwood and written by David Webb Peoples. The film stars Eastwood in the lead role, with Gene Hackman, Morgan Freeman, Richard Harris, and Jaimz Woolvett in supporting roles. The film tells the story of an aging outlaw and ex-gunfighter who takes on one last job, despite his vow to never kill again. The film was a commercial and critical success, winning the Academy Award for Best Picture, Best Director, and Best Supporting Actor (Hackman) and was nominated for Best Actor (Eastwood), Best Supporting Actor (Freeman), and Best Editing.

name: Pan's Labyrinth
synopsis: In the year 1944, Franco's fascist regime is in its last throes in a Spain devastated by a civil war that has left half a million dead. Ofelia, a little girl living with her pregnant and sick mother, discovers an imaginary and dangerous world when she finds a labyrinth near her home in the countryside. Soon she will have to choose between staying with her loving father and completing her terrible mission.

name: Casino
synopsis: RoyaleJames Bond is a British secret agent who is sent to casino in Royale-les-Eaux, France to bankrupt a terrorist financier, Le Chiffre, in a high-stakes poker game. Bond falls in love with Vesper Lynd, a beautiful Treasury agent, who is also Le Chiffre's hostage. After defeating Le Chiffre, Bond and Vesper Lynd are abducted by Mr. White, a ruthless terrorist organization's henchman. Bond is tortured for information about the money he won from Le Chiffre, but Vesper Lynd sacrifices herself to save him. Mr. White then shoots and kills Vesper before escaping.

name: Ran
synopsis: A young woman named Ran (Aoi Miyazaki) lives in a small village in Japan with her widowed father. Her father is a renowned potter and she often helps him with his work. One day, a handsome young man named Shinnosuke (SÅta Fukushi) comes to the village and Ran falls in love with him. However, her father does not approve of their relationship and forbids them from seeing each other.Ran begins to feel suffocated by her father's strict rules and decides to run away from home. She leaves a note for Shinnosuke telling him to meet her at the nearby train station. When she arrives there, she finds that her father has followed her and has brought along a group of men to take her back home. Shinnosuke intervenes and manages to get Ran away from her father's grasp.The two of them flee to Tokyo where they start a new life together. However, their happiness is short-lived as Shinnosuke is drafted into the army and is sent to fight in the war. Ran is left alone and pregnant.Years pass and Ran has not heard from Shinnosuke. She has given birth to their child and has raised him on her own. One day, she receives a telegram telling her that Shinnosuke has been killed in action. Ran is devastated by the news and her world comes crashing down.

name: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
synopsis: The movie is a spoof of the legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table. The story follows Arthur and his knights as they search for the Holy Grail. Along the way they encounter many strange and bizarre characters. The movie is full of Monty Python's trademark humor.

name: There Will Be Blood
synopsis: In There Will Be Blood, Daniel Plainview is a ruthless oil man who will stop at nothing to get what he wants. He will do whatever it takes to get what he wants, even if it means sacrificing his own son. When he finally strikes oil, he becomes even more ruthless and power hungry. The only thing that can stop him is his own greed and thirst for power.

name: A Beautiful Mind
synopsis: A Beautiful Mind is a film about the life of Nobel Prize-winning mathematician John Nash, who was diagnosed with schizophrenia. The film follows Nash's struggle to deal with his illness, as well as his remarkable achievements in mathematics and economics.

name: The Sixth Sense
synopsis: Malcolm Crowe is a successful psychologist who receives an award for his work. One night, he is visited by a former patient, Vincent, who has come to thank him for helping him. However, Vincent then proceeds to shoot Malcolm. As Malcolm lies dying, he sees Vincent's ghost. Malcolm's wife, Anna, is devastated by the tragedy. A few months later, Malcolm is contacted by Cole Sear, a young boy who is terrified that he is seeing ghosts. Malcolm is initially skeptical, but he soon realizes that Cole is indeed seeing ghosts. Together, they work to help Cole deal with his ability and to try to figure out why the ghosts are appearing to him. As they work together, Malcolm comes to understand that Cole is seeing the ghosts of people who have died with unfinished business. He also realizes that Vincent's ghost has been appearing to him, trying to get Malcolm to help him with his own unfinished business. Eventually, Malcolm and Cole are able to help all of the ghosts that have been appearing to Cole. In the process, Malcolm is able to work through his own issues surrounding Vincent's death.

name: The Truman Show
synopsis: The Truman Show is a 1998 American science fiction comedy-drama film directed by Peter Weir, produced by Scott Rudin, Andrew Niccol, Edward S. Feldman, and Adam Schroeder, and written by Niccol. The film stars Jim Carrey as Truman Burbank, a man who grew up living an ordinary life thatâunbeknownst to himâtakes place entirely within a television set. His life is broadcast throughout the world 24 hours a day and draws the attention of billions of people. However, Truman gradually discovers the truth and decides to escape the show.The Truman Show was originally a speculative screenplay by Andrew Niccol that was sold to Paramount Pictures in early 1996. Peter Weir was brought on board to direct, and Jim Carrey signed on to star in what was then a low-budget film with a budget of $60 million. The film was shot in Seaside, Florida, a town that was specially built for the film. The film was released on June 5, 1998, to critical acclaim and grossed $264 million worldwide.The Truman Show has been analyzed as a film that comments on issues such as reality television, celebrity culture, and consumerism.

name: Yojimbo
synopsis: A nameless ronin, or samurai with no lord, wanders into a remote village in feudal Japan, where two rival businessmen are struggling for control of the local gambling trade. After demonstrating his incredible swordsmanship, the ronin inserts himself into the conflict, siding first with one businessman, then the other, using his skills to help each one eliminate his enemies, and finally facing off against both in a thrilling climax. Along the way, the ronin develops a begrudging respect for his two main opponents, as well as a romantic interest in the female proprietor of the local tavern.

name: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
synopsis: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre is a drama about three American men who go to Mexico in search of gold. They find gold, but the gold is not the only thing they find.

name: Rashomon
synopsis: A woodcutter and a priest find a dead body in a forest. They soon discover that three people have different accounts of what happened. A bandit named Tajomaru claims that he kidnapped a woman and raped her. The woman's husband says that he killed Tajomaru in revenge. The woman says that both the bandit and her husband raped her.

name: The Great Escape
synopsis: A group of Allied soldiers escape from a German POW camp during World War II. Led by a British officer, the soldiers use a variety of creative and daring methods to break out of the camp and make their way to freedom. Despite the many obstacles in their way, the soldiers are ultimately successful in their escape, but not without cost.

name: Shutter Island
synopsis: A U.S. Marshal investigates the disappearance of a patient from a hospital for the criminally insane on an island off the coast of Massachusetts.

name: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
synopsis: The movie opens with The Bride (Uma Thurman) waking up from a four-year coma. She was attacked on her wedding day by a team of assassins, led by Bill (David Carradine), her former lover. The Bride sets out on a quest for revenge, seeking out each of her former attackers one by one. She eventually faces off against Bill in a final showdown.

name: Jurassic Park
synopsis: A wealthy businessman creates a theme park featuring living dinosaurs drawn from prehistoric DNA. Before opening the park to the public, he invites a select group of scientists, along with his two grandchildren, to experience the park and help calm any fears about safety. However, the safety systems fail and the dinosaurs escape, leading to a harrowing battle for survival.

name: No Country for Old Men
synopsis: The movie is set in the 1980s in the American Southwest. Llewelyn Moss (Josh Brolin) finds a pickup truck surrounded by a trail of dead bodies. He finds several cases of money and decides to take it. This sets off a ruthless pursuit by Anton Chigurh (Javier Bardem), a psychopathic hitman. The movie follows the cat-and-mouse game that ensues. Meanwhile, the old sheriff, Ed Tom Bell (Tommy Lee Jones), is trying to retire and make sense of the increasing violence and crime in the world around him.

name: The Elephant Man
synopsis: The Elephant Man is a 1980 American historical drama film directed by David Lynch and starring John Hurt, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller, Michael Elphick, Hannah Gordon, and Freddie Jones. The film tells the true story of Joseph Merrick (Hurt), a severely deformed man in late 19th century London. Merrick is found as a freak show attraction and is rescued by physician Frederick Treves (Hopkins), who brings him to the London Hospital. There, Merrick is introduced to Victorian high society and treated humanely for the first time in his life. However, as his condition deteriorates, he grows increasingly isolated and desperate for a cure. The Elephant Man ultimately becomes a tragic figure, an outsider who is unable to find acceptance in a cruel and judgmental world.

name: Finding Nemo
synopsis: Finding Nemo is a 2003 American computer-animated comedy-drama film produced by Pixar Animation Studios and released by Walt Disney Pictures. Written and directed by Andrew Stanton with co-direction by Lee Unkrich, the film stars the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, and Willem Dafoe. The film tells the story of an overprotective clownfish named Marlin who, along with a regal tang named Dory, searches for his abducted son Nemo all the way to Sydney Harbour. Finding Nemo became the highest-grossing animated film of all time at the time of its release, a record it held for eleven years until it was surpassed by Frozen (2013). The film won the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature, and was nominated in three more categories, including Best Original Screenplay.

name: Raging Bull
synopsis: Raging Bull follows the story of Jake LaMotta, a professional boxer who is considered one of the greatest fighters of all time. The film spans over a decade of LaMotta's life, from his early days as a club fighter in New York to his eventual retirement from the sport. In between, we see LaMotta's rise to the top of the boxing world, as well as his struggles with alcohol, womanizing, and violence both inside and outside the ring. Despite his many flaws, LaMotta is a fascinating and complex character, and the film is a brilliant portrait of a man who was both a champion and a self-destructive force.

name: Chinatown
synopsis: A private investigator in Los Angeles named Jake Gittes is hired by a woman named Evelyn Mulwray to follow her husband, Hollis Mulwray, the city engineer, who she believes is having an affair. Gittes tails Mulwray and photographs him with a young woman, which Mulwray's wife subsequently shows to him. Mulwray confronts Gittes and breaks his nose.A few days later, Mulwray is found dead, and Gittes is hired by Mulwray's widow to find out who killed him. Gittes's investigation leads him to Noah Cross, a powerful man with ties to the city's water supply. Cross is also Evelyn's father, and Gittes discovers that Hollis Mulwray was killed because he was about to expose Cross's scheme to control the city's water supply.Gittes confronts Cross, who admits his guilt. Cross then tries to buy Gittes off, but Gittes refuses and threatens to go to the police. Cross has his henchmen beat Gittes and leave him for dead.Evelyn Mulwray rescues Gittes and helps him to safety. The two of them then team up to take down Cross and expose his corruption.

name: Gone with the Wind
synopsis: Gone with the Wind is a 1939 American epic historical romance film directed by Victor Fleming. The film is set in the American South during the American Civil War and Reconstruction era. The film tells the story of Scarlett O'Hara, the strong-willed daughter of a Georgia plantation owner, who is determined to keep her family's land after the death of her father and the American Civil War. Scarlett falls in love with Rhett Butler, a dashing Confederate army officer, but their relationship is complicated by the social differences between their two worlds.

name: V for Vendetta
synopsis: In the future, Britain is a fascist state ruled by a tyrannical government. One man, known only as V, is determined to overthrow the government and restore freedom to the people. He is a skilled fighter and strategist, and he soon gains the support of the people. V's campaign of terror against the government culminates in a massive attack on Parliament on Guy Fawkes Day. In the aftermath, V disappears, but his legend lives on.

name: Inside Out
synopsis: Inside Out is a movie about a girl named Riley who is uprooted from her midwest life when her father starts a new job in San Francisco. The movie follows her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness - as they try to adjust to the new life and cope with the challenges that come with it. As Riley tries to find her place in the new city and school, her emotions are constantly at odds with each other, leading to some hilarious and heartwarming moments.

name: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
synopsis: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels is a British crime comedy film written and directed by Guy Ritchie, released in 1998. The film follows a group of London criminals and their interactions with each other and the wider criminal underworld. The film's title refers to a phrase often used in Cockney rhyming slang. The film stars an ensemble cast including Jason Flemyng, Dexter Fletcher, Nick Moran, Jason Statham, and Vinnie Jones.

name: The Thing
synopsis: A group of American scientists in Antarctica find themselves in the middle of a nightmare when they come face to face with a shape-shifting alien that has the ability to assume the appearance of anyone it kills. As the body count rises, the survivors must not only battle the elements, but also the fear that any one of them could be the Thing.

name: Dial M for Murder
synopsis: When Tony Wendice's wife, Margot, confesses to having an affair, Tony decides to murder her. He hatches a diabolical plot in which he blackmails an old college acquaintance, Captain Lesgate, into strangling Margot. Tony plans to make it look like a burglary gone wrong and collect on his wife's life insurance policy. But when Margot fights back and Lesgate ends up dead, Tony must improvise to avoid being caught. In a tense showdown, Tony's murderous plan unravels and Margot triumphs.

name: The Secret in Their Eyes
synopsis: A retired legal counselor writes a novel hoping to find closure for one of his unresolved homicide cases from the past.

name: The Bridge on the River Kwai
synopsis: The film is set in 1941, during World War II, and tells the story of British prisoners of war who are ordered to build a bridge to accommodate the Burma-Siam railway. Their commanding officer, Colonel Nicholson, insists on completing the bridge as a symbol of British morale, despite the horrific conditions. The prisoners are forced to work under the watch of a cruel Japanese commandant, Lt. Colonel Saito. As the prisoners labor, they come to admire and respect their commanding officer, even as they suffer in the tropical heat.The conditions take their toll, and many prisoners die. When the bridge is completed, Colonel Nicholson orders his men to destroy it, rather than let the Japanese use it. But the Japanese have other plans, and the bridge is bombed. The film ends with Colonel Nicholson's death, as he proudly surveys the remains of the bridge.

name: Howl's Moving Castle
synopsis: Sophie, a quiet girl working in a hat shop, finds her life thrown into turmoil when she is literally swept off her feet by a handsome but mysterious wizard named Howl. But after she enters his enchanted castle, she is turned into a 90-year-old woman by the Witch of the Waste. Embarking on an incredible adventure to lift the curse, she finds herself in the company of a cast of characters who will change her life forever.

name: Trainspotting
synopsis: Renton, a young man in Edinburgh, Scotland, is addicted to heroin and decides to get clean. He enters a detox program, but soon relapses and returns to using. His friends, a group of other addicts, enable his addiction and help him score drugs. Renton tries to get clean again, but the pull of addiction is too strong. He eventually overdoses and dies.

name: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri
synopsis: The film follows Mildred Hayes, who rents three billboards outside her town of Ebbing, Missouri, to call attention to the unsolved rape and murder of her daughter, Angela. The billboards ignite controversy in the town and put Mildred at odds with the local police department, particularly the well-respected Chief Bill Willoughby. As the townspeople react to the billboards in various ways, Mildred must decide whether to let the billboards remain up or to take them down.

name: Gran Torino
synopsis: Walt Kowalski is a grumpy, old widower who spends his days tending to his garden and complaining about the world around him. When his next door neighbours, a Hmong family, are targeted by a gang of thugs, Walt takes it upon himself to protect them. Despite the language barrier and cultural differences, Walt and the family form a bond, and he comes to see them as his own. When the gang members return to exact revenge, Walt is ready to stand up for what he believes in.

name: Warrior
synopsis: The film follows the story of two estranged brothers who, after the death of their father, are forced to reunite to save the family's martial arts gym. The brothers must put aside their differences to train for a Mixed Martial Arts tournament that could save their gym. Along the way, the brothers rediscover their bond and the true meaning of family.

name: Fargo
synopsis: When a car salesman hires two criminals to kidnap his wife in order to collect a ransom from her wealthy father, things quickly go south. As the body count mounts, the very pregnant police chief in charge of the investigation finds herself in a race against time to solve the case before her baby is born.

name: My Neighbor Totoro
synopsis: The movie My Neighbor Totoro is a classic Miyazaki film about two young girls, Satsuki and Mei, who move to the countryside to be closer to their hospitalized mother. They discover that their new home is inhabited by magical creatures called Totoros, who take them on adventures through the forest. The girls also meet a grumpy old man called the Catbus, who helps them get around. My Neighbor Totoro is a heartwarming story about family, friendship, and the magic of nature.

name: Prisoners
synopsis: In Pennsylvania, Keller Dover's daughter, Anna, and her friend, Joy, go missing. The police, led by Detective Loki, find Joy but not Anna. A suspect, Alex Jones, is quickly arrested, but Keller is convinced that he is not the right man and takes matters into his own hands. Keller's desperate search for answers leads him into a dark, violent world that threatens to destroy him.

name: Million Dollar Baby
synopsis: The film follows the story of Maggie Fitzgerald, a working-class girl from Missouri who dreams of becoming a professional boxer. Her gritty determination catches the eye of Frankie Dunn, an aging trainer with a long-standing reputation in the sport. Dunn takes Maggie under his wing, but despite his efforts, she is constantly underestimated because of her gender. When Maggie finally gets her big break, she must face the ultimate test against the world champion, who happens to be a man.

name: The Gold Rush
synopsis: The Gold Rush is a comedy about a prospector who heads to Alaska in search of gold. He teams up with a fellow prospector and they strike it rich. However, they soon discover that they are not the only ones after the gold and must fight for their claim. The film was written, directed, and produced by Charlie Chaplin.

name: Blade Runner
synopsis: Rick Deckard, a former blade runner for the Los Angeles Police Department, is hired by businessman Eldon Tyrell to find four rogue androids known as replicants who have escaped from an off-world colony and returned to Earth to find their creator. Deckard begins his search by tracking down a replicant named Leon Kowalski, but is quickly ambushed by another replicant, Zhora. Deckard narrowly escapes and is able to subdue Zhora with the help of his partner, Holden. Deckard continues his search for the remaining replicants, which leads him to a strip club where he meets Rachael, a replicant who does not know she is one. Deckard falls in love with Rachael, but his feelings are complicated when he is ordered to retire her. Deckard's investigation eventually leads him to the Tyrell Corporation, where he meets and is able to retire the final replicant, Roy Batty. However, before he can retire Deckard, Roy saves his life and then dies.

name: On the Waterfront
synopsis: On the Waterfront is a 1954 American crime drama film directed by Elia Kazan and written by Budd Schulberg. It stars Marlon Brando, Karl Malden, Lee J. Cobb, Rod Steiger, Pat Henning, and Eva Marie Saint. The film tells the story of union violence and corruption among longshoremen in Hoboken, New Jersey during the 1950s.

name: Catch Me If You Can
synopsis: Frank Abagnale Jr. was only 17 years old when he started passing himself off as a pilot, doctor and lawyer and cashing $2.5 million in fraudulent checks. As Frank's crimes increased, so did the level of sophistication, making him the FBI's most wanted man. FBI agent Carl Hanratty was determined to capture Frank and put an end to his elaborate con game. But Carl and Frank developed an unusual respect for each other as Carl pursued him across the globe. Eventually, Carl caught up with Frank in France and brought him back to the U.S. to face justice.

name: The Third Man
synopsis: The Third Man is a 1949 British film noir directed by Carol Reed and written by Graham Greene. It stars Joseph Cotten, Alida Valli, Trevor Howard, and Orson Welles. The film is set in post-World War II Vienna and features a critically acclaimed score by Anton Karas. Holly Martins, an American writer of pulp Westerns, arrives in Vienna to meet his friend Harry Lime, only to find out that he has recently died in a car accident. At Harry's funeral, Holly meets Harry's girlfriend, Anna Schmidt, and Anna's friend, Baron Kurtz. Kurtz tells Holly that Harry was a criminal who was killed while trying to escape the police.Holly does not believe Kurtz and begins investigating Harry's death on his own. He soon discovers that Harry was involved in a black market scheme selling diluted penicillin on the black market. Holly also discovers that Harry's "accident" may not have been an accident at all.As Holly gets closer to the truth, he finds himself in danger from the people who killed Harry. With the help of Anna and Kurtz, Holly finally uncovers the truth about Harry's death and brings the killers to justice.

name: Children of Heaven
synopsis: After his sister's shoes are ruined, a young boy in Iran must share his own worn-out sneakers with her and search for a new pair on the streets of Tehran.

name: Ben-Hur
synopsis: The film begins with a voice over narration by Lew Wallace, who wrote the book on which the film is based. The narration sets up the story, which is set in Judea in the time of Christ. The film follows the story of Judah Ben-Hur, a rich merchant prince, who is betrayed by his friend Messala and sent into slavery. After years of working as a galley slave, Judah is set free by the Roman general Quintus Arrius. Judah returns to his homeland, where he finds that his mother and sister have died in a leper colony. Judah sets out to seek revenge on Messala, but ends up finding God. In the end, Judah is forgiven by Messala and the two friends are reunited.

name: The General
synopsis: The General is a 1926 American silent comedy film directed by Buster Keaton and Clyde Bruckman. The film stars Keaton as a Confederate railway engineer who must race against time to stop a Union army train during the American Civil War.The General is widely considered to be one of the greatest films ever made. It was nominated for four Academy Awards, and is ranked #57 on the American Film Institute's list of the 100 greatest American films of all time.

name: 12 Years a Slave
synopsis: Based on an incredible true story of one man's fight for survival and freedom, 12 Years a Slave stars Chiwetel Ejiofor as Solomon Northup, a free black man who is abducted and sold into slavery. Facing cruelty as well as unexpected kindnesses, Solomon struggles not only to stay alive, but to retain his dignity. In the twelfth year of his unforgettable odyssey, Solomon's chance meeting with an abolitionist from Canada (Brad Pitt) forever changes his life.

name: Wild Strawberries
synopsis: Isak Borg, an elderly medical doctor and professor, is forced to confront the shortcomings of his life when he is awarded a honorary degree and begins to receive accolades for his work. Though he is outwardly grumpy and dismissive of the attention, Borg is secretly pleased with the recognition. However, he is haunted by memories of his first love, Sara, who died tragically, and by the choices he made in his life that led him to where he is now.Borg sets out on a road trip to Lund to accept his honorary degree, accompanied by his daughter-in-law Marianne. Along the way, they are joined by Borg's granddaughter Ingrid, who is also Marianne's daughter. The trip becomes a journey of self-discovery for Borg as he confronts his past, his regrets, and his relationships with the people around him.Wild Strawberries is a tender and introspective film that explores the choices we make in life, and how they can shape our future. Isak Borg is a complex and deeply human character, and through his journey we come to understand the importance of living life to the fullest.

name: Gone Girl
synopsis: The movie Gone Girl is about a woman who goes missing and her husband who is the prime suspect. The movie follows the husband as he tries to clear his name and find his wife. The movie is full of twists and turns that keep the audience guessing until the very end.

name: The Deer Hunter
synopsis: The Deer Hunter is a 1978 American epic war drama film directed by Michael Cimino about a trio of Russian American steelworkers whose lives were changed forever after they were drafted in the Vietnam War. The film won five Academy Awards, including Best Picture.

name: Before Sunrise
synopsis: Before Sunrise is a 1995 American romantic drama film directed by Richard Linklater and written by Linklater and Kim Krizan. The film follows two strangers who meet on a train and spend an evening together in Vienna. Jesse (Ethan Hawke), an American student, and Celine (Julie Delpy), a French student, meet on a train from Budapest and strike up a conversation. They find they have a lot in common and decide to spend the day together in Vienna. They wander around the city, talking about life and love. As the day goes on, they get to know each other better and start to fall in love. However, they both know that they will have to part ways at the end of the day. As they say goodbye, they agree to meet again in six months at the same place. Will they be able to find each other again?

name: In the Name of the Father
synopsis: In 1993, Gerry Conlon is wrongly convicted of participating in the IRA pub bombings in Guildford, which killed four off-duty British soldiers and a civilian. He spends fifteen years in prison, during which time his father, Giuseppe, visits him regularly, despite being in poor health. Gerry's girlfriend, Emma, also visits him and gives birth to their daughter, whom Gerry has never seen.In prison, Gerry meets a man named Paul Hill, who was also convicted of the Guildford bombings. Hill tells Gerry that he was not involved in the bombings and that the police tortured him into confessing. This gives Gerry hope that he may be able to clear his name.With the help of a lawyer, Gareth Peirce, Gerry and Paul are able to get their convictions overturned. They are released from prison in 1989, after serving fifteen years. Gerry is finally able to meet his daughter and make amends with his father, who has since died.

name: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
synopsis: The Dark Lord Voldemort has finally succeeded in conquering Hogwarts and killing Harry Potter. As the last remaining members of the Order of the Phoenix fight to defeat Voldemort, Harry Potter makes the ultimate sacrifice to save the world from evil.

name: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
synopsis: Jefferson Smith is a naive, idealistic man who is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. He arrives in Washington, D.C. full of optimism and hope for the future. However, he quickly discovers that the reality of politics is far different from his idealistic visions. He becomes caught up in the corrupt machinations of the political machine and finds himself in the middle of a scandal. Despite his innocence, he is forced to resign in disgrace. However, he gives a impassioned speech before the Senate that exposes the corruption and wins back the respect of his fellow Senators.

name: The Grand Budapest Hotel
synopsis: The Grand Budapest Hotel is a Wes Anderson film set in the 1930s in the fictional Republic of Zubrowka. The story follows the adventures of Gustave H., the hotel's legendary concierge, and Zero Moustafa, the lobby boy who becomes his friend and protÃ©gÃ©. The two men are caught up in a whirlwind of theft, murder, and court intrigue after the death of a wealthy dowager who leaves Gustave a priceless painting in her will.

name: The Wages of Fear
synopsis: The Wages of Fear is a 1953 thriller directed by Henri-Georges Clouzot. The film follows four European expatriots working in a South American oilfield who are recruited to transport a highly volatile cargo of nitroglycerine over treacherous mountain roads. The men, who are driven by desperation and fear, must put aside their differences to complete their mission. The Wages of Fear is a suspenseful, edge-of-your-seat thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

name: Sherlock Jr.
synopsis: A young man who dreams of being a detective like his hero, Sherlock Holmes, tries to solve a mystery his father is accused of.

name: Room
synopsis: Jack is a five year old boy who has been held captive in a small room with his mother for his entire life. His mother, who is also his only caregiver, has been raped and beaten by her captor, who Jack calls "Old Nick". Jack has never been outside, and the only world he knows is the Room.One day, Jack and his mother make a daring escape from the Room, and Jack is finally able to see the world outside. He is initially scared and confused by all the new sights and sounds, but he soon begins to adapt and learn about the world.However, the outside world is not as perfect as it seems, and Jack and his mother must deal with the harsh realities of life. They must also grapple with the trauma of their past and learn to move on.Ultimately, Jack and his mother find healing and hope in each other, and they learn that the world can be a beautiful place, despite the darkness that exists in it.

name: Barry Lyndon
synopsis: Barry Lyndon is a 1975 drama film directed by Stanley Kubrick, based on the novel The Luck of Barry Lyndon by William Makepeace Thackeray. It stars Ryan O'Neal, Marisa Berenson, Patrick Magee, and Hardy KrÃ¼ger. The film recounts the rise and fall of an Irish adventurer and gambler in 18th century England.

name: Memories of Murder
synopsis: In the small town of Gyunggi, South Korea, two detectives, Park Doo-man and Jo Young-gil, are tasked with investigating the town's first ever serial murder case. The detectives are quickly out of their depth, as they have no experience with solving crimes of this nature. With the help of a local woman, Kim Sun-jae, who has a knack for finding clues, the detectives begin to piece together the case. However, just when they think they're getting close to catching the killer, another body is found. As the detectives race against the clock to solve the case, they come to realize that the killer is always one step ahead of them.

name: The Seventh Seal
synopsis: A Medieval Knight (Max von Sydow) returns from the Crusades to find his homeland ravaged by the Black Death. He challenges Death (Bengt Ekerot) to a game of chess, hoping to stave off his own demise. As they play, the Knight encounters a series of characters who offer insights into life and death. In the end, the Knight must confront his own mortality.

name: Hacksaw Ridge
synopsis: Hacksaw Ridge is the extraordinary true story of Desmond Doss (Andrew Garfield), the first conscientious objector in American history to win the Congressional Medal of Honor. Doss was a Seventh Day Adventist who, during WWII, refused to carry or use a weapon due to his religious beliefs. He was drafted into the Army and despite immense pressure from his fellow soldiers and commanding officers, he remained true to his convictions. Doss was eventually sent to the front lines in Okinawa where, against all odds, he saved the lives of 75 men without firing a single shot. His courage and faith ultimately turned the tide in one of the bloodiest battles of the war.

name: Klaus
synopsis: Klaus is a heartwarming holiday movie about a postal worker who befriends a reclusive toymaker in a remote village and helps him rediscover the joy of Christmas. Klaus lives a lonely existence in the village of Smeerensburg, where the residents are constantly fighting with each other. One day, Klaus has a chance encounter with a young girl named Jesper, who is determined to spread cheer in the village. Jesper encourages Klaus to start making toys again and together they spread holiday cheer throughout the village. Klaus is a feel-good movie that will leave you feeling joyful and grateful for the season of giving.

name: Wild Tales
synopsis: A group of strangers find themselves trapped in a remote roadside diner with a psychopathic truck driver who has a dark secret. As the night progresses, the truck driver's secret is revealed, and the strangers are forced to band together to survive.

name: The Big Lebowski
synopsis: Jeff 'The Dude' Leboswki is mistaken for Jeffrey Lebowski, who is then roughed up and has his precious rug peed on. In search of recompense, The Dude tracks down his namesake, who offers him a job to deliver the ransom from a kidnapping. Meanwhile, The Dude's looseliving acquaintances enter into their own ambiguous dealings.

name: How to Train Your Dragon
synopsis: Hiccup (Jay Baruchel) is a Viking teenager from the island of Berk, where fighting dragons is a way of life. His world is turned upside down when he meets Toothless, a dragon he can't bring himself to kill. Against all odds, Hiccup and Toothless form a unique friendship that changes both of their lives forever.

name: Mad Max: Fury Road
synopsis: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the help of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper, and a drifter named Max.

name: Pather Panchali
synopsis: Pather Panchali is a 1955 Indian Bengali-language drama film directed by Satyajit Ray and produced by the Government of West Bengal. It is based on Bibhutibhushan Bandopadhyay's 1929 Bengali novel of the same name and is Ray's directorial debut. It features Subir Banerjee, Kanu Banerjee, Karuna Banerjee, Uma Dasgupta, and Chunibala Devi in central roles. The first film in Ray's Apu Trilogy, Pather Panchali depicts the childhood of the protagonist Apu (portrayed by Banerjee and Dasgupta) and his elder sister Durga (portrayed by Devi) in a poor Bengali village.The novel Pather Panchali was first published in Bengali in 1928. Bibhutibhushan Bandopadhyay's story of the coming of age of Apu, a young boy in a Bengali village, first appeared in print in the Bengali periodical Probashi in 1925. In the years that followed, the story was serialized in several other Bengali magazines and newspapers, including Desh, which is how Ray first came across it.Ray began working on the film in 1950, but it took five more years to complete due to financial difficulties. It was shot entirely on location in the village of Bibhutibishnupur in West Bengal, India. The film's title means "The Song of the Little Road" in Bengali. Pather Panchali is frequently listed among the greatest films of all time.

name: Mary and Max
synopsis: A young girl named Mary discovers a wounded kangaroo in her backyard and nurses it back to health. She names the kangaroo Max and the two become friends. When Max is fully recovered, he is released back into the wild. Mary and Max stay in touch through letters and eventually meet in person again. They remain friends for life.

name: Jaws
synopsis: Jaws is a 1975 American thriller film directed by Steven Spielberg and based on Peter Benchley's 1974 novel of the same name. In the film, a giant man-eating great white shark attacks beachgoers on Amity Island, a fictional New England summer resort town, prompting police chief Martin Brody (Roy Scheider) to hunt it with the help of a marine biologist (Richard Dreyfuss) and a professional shark hunter (Robert Shaw).The film's success helped Spielberg launch his career as a Hollywood blockbusters director, and Jaws became the highest-grossing film of all time until the release of Star Wars in 1977. It won several awards for its editing, music, and sound effects, and was nominated for four Academy Awards, including Best Picture.

name: The Passion of Joan of Arc
synopsis: The film tells the story of Joan of Arc, a young woman who led an army into battle against the English in order to save her country during the Hundred Years' War. Captured by the English, she was tried and convicted of heresy and burned at the stake. The film is a faithful adaptation of the trial transcripts and the final days of Joan's life.

name: Monsters, Inc.
synopsis: Monsters, Inc. is a 2001 American computer-animated comedy film produced by Pixar Animation Studios and released by Walt Disney Pictures. The film centers on two monstersâSully and Mikeâwho work in the titular electricity-generating factory. The factory's power comes from the screams of human children, which are harvested through closet doors that open into children's bedrooms.Sully and Mike's world is turned upside down when a human child, Boo, accidentally enters the factory. Sully and Mike must find a way to return Boo to her home before it's too late. Along the way, they discover that the factory's power source is not as it seems, and that the monsters may not be as scary as they thought.

name: Hotel Rwanda
synopsis: The film Hotel Rwanda is set during the Rwandan Genocide in 1994. It tells the true story of Paul Rusesabagina (played by Don Cheadle), the manager of the HÃ´tel des Mille Collines in Kigali, Rwanda. As the country descends into chaos, Paul uses his position and influence to protect the Tutsi refugees who have sought shelter at the hotel. But with the United Nations and the world turning a blind eye to the massacre, Paul must risk his own life to save the lives of his guests.

name: Tokyo Story
synopsis: An aging couple, Tomi and Sukie, travel from their home in the country to visit their children in the city. However, their children are too busy with their own lives to spend much time with them. Tomi and Sukie end up spending most of their time with their granddaughter, Noriko. As they grow closer, the couple starts to remember the good times they had raising their children. They also come to realize that their children are now adults with their own lives and families. In the end, Tomi and Sukie return home, content in knowing that their children still love them.

name: Dead Poets Society
synopsis: Todd Anderson and his friends at Welton Academy can hardly believe how different life is now that their new English professor, the unconventional John Keating, is encouraging them to "make your lives extraordinary." As Keating inspires his students to pursue their dreams and not be afraid to stand up for what they believe in, the boys take his words to heartâand their lives will never be the same.

name: Platoon
synopsis: Chris Taylor is a young, naive American who joins the Army to fight in Vietnam, but quickly learns that he is in over his head. He is sent to the front lines, where he experiences the horrors of war firsthand. He soon befriends a hardened veteran named Sergeant Barnes, who takes him under his wing. But when Barnes is ordered to kill a suspected enemy sympathizer, the lines begin to blur between friend and foe. As the war takes its toll on Taylor's sanity, he must decide who he is fighting for: himself, or his fellow soldiers.

name: Rocky
synopsis: Rocky Balboa is a small-time boxer who seems to be going nowhere in life. When heavyweight champion Apollo Creed visits Philadelphia, his managers want to set up a boxing match between Creed and Rocky. Rocky agrees to the fight, even though he knows he doesn't stand a chance.The fight takes place and, as expected, Rocky is soundly defeated. However, he wins the respect of Apollo and the crowd with his determination and heart. This inspires Rocky to start training harder and he eventually becomes a contender for the heavyweight title.Rocky faces many challenges along the way, including a tough opponent in the form of Clubber Lang, but he eventually gets his shot at the title. In a gripping final bout, Rocky defeats Lang and becomes the heavyweight champion of the world.

name: Ford v Ferrari
synopsis: The film follows the true story of how American car designer Carroll Shelby and British-born driver Ken Miles came together to build a revolutionary race car for Henry Ford II and take on the dominating Ferrari race team at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in France in 1966.

name: Stand by Me
synopsis: The movie Stand by Me is about four young boys who go on an adventure to find a dead body. The boys, Gordie, Chris, Teddy, and Vern, are all from different backgrounds and have different personalities. They all become friends after going on this adventure together. The movie follows them as they grow up and face different challenges in their lives.

name: The Terminator
synopsis: The Terminator is a 1984 American science fiction film directed by James Cameron. It stars Arnold Schwarzenegger as the Terminator, a cyborg assassin sent back in time from 2029 to 1984 to kill Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton), whose son will one day become a savior against machines in a future war. Michael Biehn plays Kyle Reese, a soldier from the future sent back in time to protect Sarah. The screenplay is credited to Cameron, Gale Anne Hurd, and William Wisher.

name: Rush
synopsis: Dr. William Rush is a "medical fixer" who discreetly helps the wealthy and powerful with their medical problems. He is asked to help a senator who has been diagnosed with a brain tumor, but Rush is reluctant to get involved. However, he changes his mind when he learns that the senator's wife is pregnant and wants to keep the pregnancy a secret. Rush is able to successfully remove the tumor and the senator's wife gives birth to a healthy baby.

name: Spotlight
synopsis: The film follows the Boston Globe's "Spotlight" team, the oldest continuously operating newspaper investigative unit in the United States, as it investigates allegations of abuse in the Catholic Church. In 2001, new editor Marty Baron (Liev Schreiber) pushes the team to investigate allegations of sexual abuse of children by Catholic priests. The team, including Walter "Robby" Robinson (Michael Keaton), Mike Rezendes (Mark Ruffalo), Sacha Pfeiffer (Rachel McAdams), and Matt Carroll (Brian d'Arcy James), reluctantly begins its investigation. However, as they connect the dots, the team uncovers a horrifying pattern of sexual abuse and cover-ups within the Church that spans decades. With the pressure mounting, the team races to find the truth before the statute of limitations expires and the perpetrators are able to walk free.

name: Into the Wild
synopsis: The movie, Into the Wild, is based on a true story and follows the journey of Christopher McCandless. After graduating from college, McCandless decides to forgo the traditional route of getting a job and embark on a journey across America. He hitchhikes and hops freight trains, living off the land and encountering many interesting characters along the way. His ultimate goal is to reach Alaska, where he plans to live off the grid in complete isolation. However, as McCandless's journey comes to an end, he must face the harsh realities of nature and decide whether to continue living in the wild or return to society.

name: Network
synopsis: The film is set in the early 1970s, when the U.S. television industry was undergoing massive changes. Networks were starting to merge, and programming was becoming more and more homogenized. At the fictional UBS network, veteran news anchor Howard Beale is fired after he goes on a on-air tirade. But Beale's ratings go through the roof when he starts preaching his own brand of anti-establishment rhetoric, and the network sees an opportunity to cash in. They give him his own show, which quickly becomes a platform for him to lash out at anyone and everyone he feels is responsible for the country's problems. As Beale's popularity grows, so does his ego and his sense of power. But the network begins to worry that he may be going too far, and they start to look for ways to control him. Meanwhile, an ambitious young producer named Diana Christensen sees Beale as the key to her own plans for taking over the network. She manipulates him, the network, and the viewing public in her quest for power. The film follows the rise and fall of Howard Beale, and the dark side of the television industry that made him a star.

name: The Wizard of Oz
synopsis: The Wizard of Oz is a 1939 American musical fantasy film produced by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer. The film stars Judy Garland as Dorothy Gale, who is swept away from her Kansas farm home by a cyclone to the magical land of Oz. After a series of adventures, she joins forces with her new friends, the Scarecrow, the Tin Woodman, and the Cowardly Lion, to defeat the Wicked Witch of the West and return home to Kansas.

name: Logan
synopsis: In the near future, a weary Logan cares for an ailing Professor X in a hideout on the Mexican border. But Logan's attempts to hide from the world and his legacy are upended when a young mutant arrives, pursued by dark forces.

name: Groundhog Day
synopsis: In the movie Groundhog Day, Phil Connors is a cynical news reporter who is sent to cover the annual Groundhog Day event in Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania. He's not happy about it, but he soon finds himself stuck in a time loop, reliving the same day over and over again. At first, Phil tries to use the situation to his advantage, but he eventually realizes that he's trapped in a nightmare. He tries to escape the loop by killing himself, but he always wakes up back on Groundhog Day. As Phil starts to lose hope, he meets a woman named Rita, who helps him see the beauty in life. In the end, Phil learns to appreciate the day and the people around him, and he is finally able to break out of the time loop.

name: Ratatouille
synopsis: A rat named Remy dreams of becoming a great French chef in spite of his family's wishes and the obvious problem of being a rat in a decidedly rodent-phobic profession. When fate places Remy in the sewers of Paris, he finds himself ideally situated beneath a restaurant made famous by his culinary hero, Auguste Gusteau. Despite the apparent dangers of being an unlikely - and certainly unwanted - visitor in the kitchen of a fine French restaurant, Remy's passion for cooking soon sets into motion a hilarious and exciting rat race that turns the culinary world of Paris upside down.

name: The Exorcist
synopsis: The Exorcist is a movie about a girl who is possessed by a demon and her mother's attempt to save her with the help of two priests. The demon is eventually exorcised, but not before it wreaks havoc on the girl's body and mind.

name: Before Sunset
synopsis: Nine years after they first met, Celine and Jesse are reunited in Paris. They spend an afternoon and evening together, walking and talking about their past and their hopes for the future. They realize that they still have strong feelings for each other, but Celine is about to get married and Jesse is about to move to New York. As they say goodbye, they agree to meet again in six months.

name: The Best Years of Our Lives
synopsis: The Best Years of Our Lives is a 1946 American drama film directed by William Wyler and starring Myrna Loy, Fredric March, Dana Andrews, Teresa Wright, Virginia Mayo, and Harold Russell. The film is about three World War II veterans who return home to small-town America to find that they and their families face challenges in adjusting to life after war.

name: The Incredibles
synopsis: The Incredibles follows the story of a family of superheroes who are forced to retire and live a normal life after a lawsuit reveals their identities. However, when an evil villain threatens the world, they must don their costumes once again and use their powers to save the day.

name: The Battle of Algiers
synopsis: The Battle of Algiers is a 1966 historical drama film directed by Gillo Pontecorvo and starring Marlon Brando, Jean Martin, and Jack Palance. The film, shot in a documentary style, depicts the history of the Algerian Revolution against the French government in the 1950s. The film has been praised for its realistic and unbiased portrayal of the events, as well as its use of newsreel-style footage.

name: Rebecca
synopsis: When a young woman arrives at the imposing estate of Manderley she finds herself vying for the attention of the brooding Maxim de Winter alongside the memory of his late wife Rebecca, who died in a tragic boating accident. The new Mrs. de Winter is consumed by jealousy and insecurity, but Maxim is still haunted by the ghost of his first wife. As she struggles to fit into her new role, she uncovers secrets about Rebecca that threaten to destroy her marriage and her sanity.

name: To Be or Not to Be
synopsis: In the midst of World War II, a Polish theatre troupe struggles to keep their spirits high as the Nazi regime encroaches on their lives. When their leading lady, Maria, is recruited by the Polish resistance to help gather intelligence on the Nazis, the troupe must put on a brave face and continue their work, despite the ever-increasing danger around them. As the war rages on, the troupe must decide whether to stay and fight or flee the country.

name: The Grapes of Wrath
synopsis: The film tells the story of the Joad family, who, like many other families in America during the 1930s, are forced to leave their home and travel west to find work. The family travels in their old car, which breaks down frequently, and they often have to resort to stealing food to survive. They eventually end up in California, where they find work picking grapes. However, they are treated poorly by their employers and are constantly exploited. The family is also constantly threatened by the police, who are cracking down on migrant workers. The film follows the family as they struggle to survive and ultimately triumph over their adversities.

name: Cool Hand Luke
synopsis: The film tells the story of Luke Jackson, a man who is sentenced to two years in a Florida prison farm for cutting the heads off parking meters. During his time in prison, Luke becomes a model prisoner, but constantly tests the patience of the prison warden and the other prisoners. After Luke is caught escaping from prison, he is put in "the box" and given a brutal beating. This only strengthens Luke's resolve, and he continues to test the authorities. Ultimately, Luke's rebelliousness leads to his tragic death.

name: Hachi: A Dog's Tale
synopsis: Hachi: A Dog's Tale is a heartwarming story of a dog's unyielding loyalty to his owner. Based on a true story, Hachiko was an Akita dog in Japan during the 1920s who would wait at the train station every day for his owner to return from work. Even after his owner's death, Hachiko continued to go to the station every day for nine years until his own death. Hachiko's story touched the hearts of the Japanese people and continues to be an inspiration to people around the world.

It tells the story of three different people in Mexico City who are interconnected by their love for dogs and their own personal struggles. The first story follows a young man named Octavio (Bernal) who is trying to support his pregnant wife and family by running a dog-fighting ring. The second story follows Valeria (Bauche), a model who is involved in an abusive relationship with her husband. The third story follows El Chivo (EchevarrÃ­a), a former revolutionary who now lives as a homeless man and takes care of stray dogs. All three stories are linked together by the characters' relationships with their dogs, as well as their own personal struggles.

name: Dersu Uzala
synopsis: In the early 1900s, a Russian geographer, captain and explorer named Vladimir Arsenyev is dispatched to the Siberian Far East on a mapping expedition. In the wilderness, he and his men come across a local hunter and trapper named Dersu Uzala, who agrees to help them navigate the treacherous terrain. Over the course of several months, the two men form a deep bond as they face the challenges of the wild together. But when the time comes for Arsenyev to return to civilization, Dersu realizes that he is no longer able to adapt to life in the city and decides to go back to his home in the mountains.

name: My Father and My Son
synopsis: In the film My Father and My Son, a father and son are forced to confront the ugly reality of their relationship when the son is diagnosed with cancer. The father, a successful businessman, has always been distant and cold towards his son, and the son has always resented him for it. However, when the son is diagnosed with cancer, the father is forced to face his own mortality and his relationship with his son. The father and son begin to bond over their shared experience of cancer, and the father finally begins to understand his son. However, just as the father and son are beginning to connect, the son dies from his cancer. The father is left devastated and must grapple with his own guilt and sorrow.

name: The 400 Blows
synopsis: The 400 Blows is a 1959 French coming-of-age drama film directed by FranÃ§ois Truffaut. The film follows Antoine Doinel, a misunderstood adolescent in Paris during the 1950s, as he struggles to find himself amid the overwhelming indifference of the adult world. The film earned several awards, including the Cannes Film Festival's Best Director Award.

name: Persona
synopsis: A young nurse, Alma, is tasked with caring for a famous and reclusive actress, Elizabet, who has mysteriously stopped speaking. As Alma spends more time with Elizabet, she finds herself increasingly drawn into her patient's inner life and begins to identify with her. When Alma tries to break through to Elizabet, she instead unleashes a dark force that threatens to destroy them both.

name: Life of Brian
synopsis: The movie is a comedy about a man named Brian who is born on the same day as, and next door to, Jesus Christ. Brian grows up in Judea during the time of the Roman occupation. As an adult, Brian becomes a member of a rebel group who are fighting against the Romans. He is eventually captured and sentenced to be crucified. However, he is rescued at the last minute and lives to tell the story of his life.

name: La Haine
synopsis: La Haine is a French film set in the banlieues of Paris in the aftermath of the riots that took place in the city in 2005. The film follows three young men - Vinz, SaÃ¯d, and Hubert - as they try to cope with the racism and violence that they face on a daily basis. The three friends are from different ethnic backgrounds - Vinz is Jewish, SaÃ¯d is Arab, and Hubert is black - but they have all grown up in the same neighborhood and have experienced the same struggles. As the film progresses, the three friends find themselves at a crossroads, and they must decide whether to give in to the hate that surrounds them or to find a way to rise above it.

name: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
synopsis: The movie is set in the Caribbean during the early 18th century. Jack Sparrow, a pirate, is captured by the British Royal Navy. He is brought to trial and sentenced to death. However, he is rescued by his crew and returns to the Caribbean.The Black Pearl, a pirate ship, attacks a Spanish vessel. The Spanish governor, Norrington, wants to take down the Black Pearl and its captain, Barbossa. He enlists the help of Sparrow, who agrees to help in exchange for his freedom.Sparrow and Norrington sail to an island where the Black Pearl is docked. They are ambushed by Barbossa and his crew, and Sparrow is taken captive.Barbossa plans to use Sparrow to break an ancient curse that was placed on him and his crew. The curse turns them into immortal skeletons at night.Sparrow escapes and rescues Elizabeth Swann, the governor's daughter, who has been taken captive by Barbossa. They return to the island, where Sparrow and Elizabeth confront Barbossa.Sparrow and Elizabeth are able to break the curse, and Barbossa and his crew are defeated.

name: It Happened One Night
synopsis: A spoiled socialite (Claudette Colbert) is fleeing her father (Walter Connolly) and her upcoming marriage. She meets a reporter (Clark Gable) who is also trying to escape his problems. The two end up falling in love and helping each other out along the way.

name: The Sound of Music
synopsis: The Sound of Music is a musical based on the life of Maria von Trapp. It tells the story of how Maria, a young nun, is sent to live with the von Trapp family as a governess to the children. Maria falls in love with the children and their father, Georg, and they eventually get married. The family then has to flee Austria when the Nazis invade. They eventually make it to America and start a new life. The movie features many popular songs, including "Do-Re-Mi", "Edelweiss", and "My Favorite Things".

name: The Handmaiden
synopsis: A young woman is hired as a handmaiden to a Japanese heiress who is living under the watch of a Korean man hired to control her inheritance. The handmaiden and the Korean man form a plan to defraud the heiress and gain her fortune. The plan involves the handmaiden seducing the heiress and then convincing her to elope with a fake suitor. The Korean man will then be able to claim the heiress's fortune for himself. The plan is complicated when the handmaiden and the heiress develop real feelings for each other.

name: Gandhi
synopsis: The film opens in India in the early 1900s with a young Mohandas Gandhi (Ben Kingsley) living a peaceful life as a lawyer. However, the country is soon thrown into turmoil as the British colonial government imposes harsh laws on the Indian people. Gandhi begins to protest the unjust treatment of his people, and his peaceful protests quickly gain national attention. As the Indian people rally behind Gandhi, the British government realizes that they are dealing with a powerful force that they cannot control. ultimately, Gandhi's protests lead to India's independence from Britain.

name: Aladdin
synopsis: When street-urchin Aladdin vies for the love of the beautiful princess Jasmine, he uses a genie's magic power to become a prince in order to marry her. Iago, Jafar, the Genie and more larger-than-life characters fill out this animated adventure.

name: The Help
synopsis: Based on the best-selling novel by Kathryn Stockett, "The Help" tells the story of black maids working in white households in Jackson, Mississippi during the early 1960s. The maids are constantly subjected to racism, sexism, and other forms of discrimination, but they band together to help a young white woman write a book about their experiences. The book is a huge success, and the maids are finally able to tell their stories and be recognized for their work.

name: Beauty and the Beast
synopsis: A young woman named Belle is taken prisoner by a beast in his castle. Despite her fears, she befriends the castle's enchanted staff and learns to look beyond the Beast's hideous exterior, seeing the kind heart and soul of the true prince that lies within.

name: The Batman
synopsis: The movie is about Bruce Wayne, who becomes Batman to fight crime in Gotham City. He battles villains such as the Joker, Two-Face, and the Penguin.

name: Rififi
synopsis: In Rififi, a group of four criminals come together to pull off a heist. The plan is meticulously planned and executed, but things start to go wrong when one of the men betrays the others. The betrayal leads to a violent showdown, and the heist does not go as planned. Despite the setbacks, the criminals are able to make off with the loot and go their separate ways.

name: Dances with Wolves
synopsis: In the year 1863, Lt. John Dunbar is injured in battle and left for dead. When he regains consciousness, he finds that he is the only survivor from his unit. He makes his way back to the fort, where he is hailed as a hero and offered a promotion. Dunbar, not wanting to be a hero, asks to be reassigned to the western frontier. There, he befriends a wolf he names Two Socks and a Sioux tribe led by Chief Ten Bears. Dunbar eventually falls in love with a Sioux woman named Stands With a Fist, who is the widow of a white man. As their relationship deepens, Dunbar comes to understand the Sioux way of life and fights to protect them from the U.S. cavalry.
